description.narrative: Organization Centers for Civic Initiatives (CCI) har från Sida sökt finansiering om 5 miljoner SEK (5 00 000 SEK) för att genomföra projektet More efficient public audits for less corruption in BH - (Public Audits with CCI) under perioden 2019-2022. Huvudsakliga mål med åtgärden är att bidra till mer ansvarsfullt utnyttjande av budgetmedel samt att minska korruption, hos de officiella institutionerna i BiH. Specifika mål med projektet är: 1. Öka insyn gällande både offentliga revisoners effektivitet och de rekommendationer som sedan 2014 getts in till BiHs offentliga institutioner, 2. Stärka det offentliga deltagandet vid val av vilka institutioner som ska bli föremål för revision – med syfte att bättre fånga in institutioner med korrupta arbetssätt, 3. Initiera politisk process för att (a) stärka rättsliga påföljder vid underlåtenhet att implementera rekommendationer från revisionen, (b) reformera den nuvarande rollen som parlamentets utskott för revision har och (c) etablera samarbete mellan åklagare och revision. Åtgärdens totala budget är 5 millioner SEK (5 000 000 SEK).

Organization Centers for Civic Initiatives (CCI) has applied to Sida for funding of 5 million SEK (5 000 000 SEK) to carry out the project " More efficient public audits for less corruption in BH" - (Public Audits with CCI) during the period 2019-2022. The main goal of the intervention is to contribute to a more responsible spending of budget funds and to reduction of corruption in the public institutions in BiH. Specific objectives of the project are: 1. Increase transparency about effectiveness of the auditing processes and recommendations that have been submitted to BiH public institutions from 2014 till present, 2. Strengthen the participation of public in selection of public institutions that will be subject of auditing – in order to better target institutions with corruption practices, 3. Initiate a policy processes and advocating for (a) strengthening legal penalties for not implementing auditors' recommendations, (b) reforming current role of parliaments’ committees for audits and (c) establishing cooperation between prosecution and audit office
The intervention’s total budget is 5 million SEK (5 000 000 SEK)

This project intend to make a difference and use the mandate of newly elected/appointed authorities (particularly members of entities and state parliaments) to improve current situation within the auditing system and structures. Legislative and practical improvements will include:(a) creation of public e-database of all recommendations delivered from both entities' audit services during 2014 – 2018, with names of audited public institutions and responsible persons; (b) active monitoring and analysis of those institutions from data base above and their measures overtaken for implementing auditors’ recommendations (all institutions that are in the e-base will be requested to provide information on the steps they have taken in relation to the implementation of the auditors' recommendations – the ones who refuse to provide this information will be sued to the competent institutions, including courts); (c) strengthening public participation in work of public audit agencies - by establishing e-tools for public (citizens, private enterprises and civic society) to propose which public institutions will be audited in fiscal year, (d) strong informative and advocacy media campaign (traditional and Internet media) on analysis’ findings, accountable individuals (with their names) and proposed policies for reforming audit sector thus making public auditors’ reports and accountability for them as one of key issues in the society, (e) initiating the process of changing and amending the laws to increase and individualize the penalties for failure to implement the auditors' recommendations (penalties for leaders of public institutions - financial and criminal offenses) but also for reforming outdated role and practice of parliaments’ committees dealing with audits and (f) initiating establishment of coordination bodies between prosecution and public audit so to exchange info and improve synergy in confronting corruption in public institutions.

tag.narrative: 16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

description.narrative: During the second year of the Project implementation, CCI initiated established a Working group (WG) with relevant institutional representatives, stimulating the exchange and cooperation between the executives of the relevant institutions. The WG gathers relevant institutional representatives in the audit processes: the audit offices of BiH institutions, representatives of the commissions for finances and budgets Parliamentary Assembly of BiH, prosecutors' offices in BiH, APIK (Agency for Prevention of Corruption and Coordination of the Fights against Corruption), Public Procurement Agency, BiH Court, State Agency for Investigations and Protection and Civil Service Agency, who met three times during the reporting period. The working group is also included in the Strategy for Improving Public Financial Management 2021-2025. adopted by the BiH Council of Ministers. CCI coordinated and initiated in the House of Representatives of the Parliament of FBiH forming the Parliamentary Commission responsible for the audit. CCI implemented the intensive informative-advocating campaign, underlining the relevance of the parliamentary supervision over public spending. The Parliament did not form this commission for more than two years, and it was finally established upon CCI's strong initiative. Consequently, the Commission was formed and appointed at the end of June 2020. The CCI closely followed the work of this commission, monitored the organised public hearings with the audited subjects, and suggested the content and organisation of the audit hearings for future ones. The project particularly focused on cantonal and local level activities regarding the parliamentary supervision over the audit findings and implementing recommendations. CCI referred the initiatives to cantonal and local parliaments, urging them to plan the review of the audit reports in their work programs for 2021. Ahead of the local elections 2020, CCI requested the political subjects in Brcko District to explicitly state and give a written public promise that their candidates would support establishing a more efficient implementation of the audit findings and recommendations. They also committed to defining the guidelines for the further conduct of the audited subjects, on deadlines and activities on implementing the requests and setting the mechanism for sanctioning institutions and individuals who fail to implement the recommendations. Fourteen political subjects publicly committed to support the development and enforcement of such guidelines, among others the party of Brcko Mayor, who is also in charge of the guideline's development and adoption. A panel online conference Impact Audit, "Activities of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina mandated institutions on the decrease of air pollution", gathered representatives of relevant institutions that can improve the activities in decreasing the air pollution, following the impact audit findings. Work with media and media promotion of activities is of great value to the project. In the reviewing period, the project conducted, prepared, and published five analyses about the public audit process and the recommendations for the improvement, with seven follow-up info advocacy campaigns and 22 public/media announcements released. The project was subject to mid-term evaluation. The evaluation findings pointed out that the project has greatly contributed to attracting the attention of the public and actors to the topic of the audit, audit reports, implementation of the audit reports, bringing these topics closing to the citizens and capacitating them to understand and closely follow responsibility of the institutions in spending the public budget funds. During the implementation of activities in the reviewing period, the whole world faced a great challenge, the COVID- 19 pandemics, which has significantly affected the project implementation modalities. Despite significant restrictions, CCI managed to maintain the planned project dynamics, overcoming the limits regarding the meetings in person, using online applications for the organization of the forum and events. The project fully adapted to the new circumstances and managed to implement the planned activities, accomplishing the set results and expected impact.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
